google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please check the time on your phone. Time-based tokens are very sensitive to time differences. Even small offsets of 30 sec can cause problems with some services.

google_play_reviews.content: Ho do i recover my authentication code. I am forgot that code. Pls suggest.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: andOTP works completely offline and encrypts all your data with your password. So there is no way to reset the password without deleting all data. If you have a current backup you can reset the app, set it up again with a new password and restore the backup.

How the hell do I use this? I'm completely lost, can't make it do anything except put my pin in and get a blank white and green screen. How and what do I add? When I tap the add prompt, what do I put in? When put something in, it does nothing and no help. I can't find anything on the internet to help!
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
andOTP is an open source replacement for apps like Google Authenticator or Microsoft Authenticator. You can use it everywhere you can use those two (or similar) apps.

Basically you need an account that supports 2FA (Google, Microsoft, Github...). When you enable 2FA on that account you get a QR code that you can scan with andOTP.

google_play_reviews.content: On version 0.8.0 I can no longer back up to and restore from my Google drive. There seems to be no way to set that up anymore. The choices are limited to internal storage and my SD card. Am I doing something wrong? If you have a solution, I'll try it, and then give your app extra stars.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
andOTP uses the "Storage Access Framework" for backups, which is the only way to access the devices storage on newer Android versions. Direct access, like we use to have before, is sadly no longer possible.
If an app does not show up in the selection it means that it does not fully implement all necessary functions for the SAF and we can't use it.

I forgot my "Authentifizierungs PIN". How can i fix that?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Sadly there is not much you can do here. andOTP works completely offline and encrypts your data using that PIN code, so when you lose it, there is no way to restore access. That is one reason there is an integrated backup function. If you have a current backup you can reset the app (in your phones settings), set it up again and restore the backup.

google_play_reviews.content: Great app

Best 2FA App out there! Thankful this FOSS app was suggested after I lost ALL my accts after phone reset b/c Google Auth doesn't backup. Needed ability to backup keys via encrypted file, compatibly w/ every acct & ability to manually enter keys since I rarely scan QR Codes. AndOTP does all the above + tags, custom icons, name editing, option to hide codes, 1-step copy to clipboard, passcode lock, add via screenshot of QR, autoclose after copying, autolock, lightweight, fast & privacy focused! Ty

Great TOTP app, but please support barcode-chosen icons like FreeOTP does (but without the bugs). This feature consists of the "image" parameter in the barcode, and code to "download" that image and store the actual image along with the other data for the account.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your review. What exactly do you mean with barcode-chosen icons? If you scan a QR code and the supplied "issuer" parameter inside the code (e.g. issuer=Github) matches an icon that is available in andOTP it will already automatically be selected. Is that what you mean? If that's not working correctly please open a bug report on Github

I'm unable to set my encryption from password/pin to Android Keystore. I recieve "encryption key not loaded" and no further information to resolve. I don't want to have to use a password to view these, so unfortunately I can't seem to get the app to function correctly.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Seems like there is something wrong with your KeyStore, you can try resetting the apps data (from your Android Settings under Apps -> andOTP -> Storage -> Clear Storage) and setting it up again from scratch. If that doesn't help please open a bug report on our Github.

Love the app, its great, but is it possible to add fingerprint authentication instead of just pin/password?
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Thank you for your nice words. Fingerprint login is possible with a small workaround, check the FAQ: https://github.com/andOTP/andOTP/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions#user-content-faq1 (or use the FAQ button in the apps About screen).

Fingerprint login in combination with that password/PIN encryption is still on the todo list.

google_play_reviews.content: Very happy that this app has backup and many security features

Extremely neat and easy-to-use app which shows a "countdown bar" for when the shown codes expire. Also great 1-tab copy function and backup. But ould be really nice being able to set fingerprint to unlock. You CAN just use the phone's unlock mechanism, however, it's awkward when you got iris unlock activated to easily check if you got notifs, but you don't wanna ACCIDENTALLY unlock the app by staring at your screen with it open
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
You can already do that: https://github.com/andOTP/andOTP/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions#user-content-faq1

Adding a simple option for fingerprint unlocking, especially in combination with the password-based encryption is still planed. But it will take a while since I don't have a lot time to work on the project currently.

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent TOTP app. It allows passwords to block the app and encrypt the database. You can also export your encrypted database for backup purposes. It's also open source. It has everything I need in an app of this type.

love the backup features!
Great app!
everytime I open the app and have to enter PIN, the keypad does not automatically pop up. It's a mild annoyance, but it would make things easier if it did. otherwise, seems to be a great app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your nice review. It actually used to be that way with the keypad until I somehow messed it up in the last update. But don't worry, it has already been fixed and will be added back in the next release.

google_play_reviews.content: Has all the great features that Google Authenticator should have had in the first place, thank you!!! boo to Google !!!
Finally an Authenticator with search, filter, and tag functionality. Great job!

Thank you for providing a great alternative to other Authenticators! I read in one of your posts that you're rewriting the app from scratch? If so, is Webdav compatibility (Nextcloud/Owncloud) for backup destinations on the todo list with scheduled exports? Keep up the great work! I also agree with others that you should have a donation version for those that appreciate your efforts and are more than happy to send some funds your way.
The best of all OTP apps I've tried
Best Android otp

Great OTP. Fingerprint unlock option, pin unlock option, and simpe manual backup of OTP database with PGP encryption keys to remote server of choice (drive/dropbox). Best FOSS OTP. Recommend using OpenKey app for PGP Encryption of database. Surprisingly simple setup.
The backup feature, and the fact that it lets you encrypt it using OpenKeychain is awesome!
Great

I just spent the last 2 hours turning off Two Factor and then re-enabling because I got a new phone. In the future I'm so glad I will be able to switch devices and restore all of my accounts.  I wish you would add support for custom icons though. I have a couple of accounts like Mail Chimp, and Zoho and a couple of games I could use some icons for, to complete the aesthetic.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the nice review, the backup problem was basically the reason I wrote andOTP. Support for custom icons is already on out todo list, the only problem is that we don't have a lot of time to work on the app currently.

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent authenticator with minimal permissions, encrypted backups, and a clean ui. What more could you want?

Sch√∂ne App. Gewechselt habe ich wegen der Backup-Funktion. Leider wird  die Accountbeschriftung nach wenigen Zeichen abgeschnitten, wovon der Name der Website schon viel verbraucht. Das l√∂st Google Authenticatior  durch einen kleineren Font bzw. Linksb√ºndigkeit besser. Man k√∂nnte auch das Account-Logo auf die Gr√∂√üe des OTP-Fonts verkleinern, um Platz zu schaffen. Daher vorerst nur 4 Sterne.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Vielen Dank f√ºr die nette Bewertung. Ein etwas platzsparender Anzeige-Modus steht schon auf meiner Todo-Liste, leider habe ich im Moment nicht sehr viel Zeit um an der App zu arbeiten, aber das √§ndert sich hoffentlich bald.

google_play_reviews.content: Very useful and usable.
Qr code scan not working, though it sayin place your barcode in rectangle -_-
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please open a bug report on our Github page and include a log so we can figure out what is going wrong.

google_play_reviews.content: The best authenticator app. Open source and requires no unnecessary permissions, not even internet access.
How can we use it for telegram acount?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: As far as I know Telegram does not support TOTP. It uses a SMS code by default and only allows you to set an additional password as 2nd factor.

google_play_reviews.content: I am tired of having to type password. Can I use fingerprints to open application?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Yes you can, but you have to switch your encryption to Android KeyStore and then chose Device Credentials as authentication. I'm currently rewriting the app to change that so you can use fingerprint everywhere.

google_play_reviews.content: Works like a charm on my OnePlus 6. I specifically wanted a local backup feature, and it works perfectly. No need to trust my credentials to the server of a mysterious company who didn't even update their Google Search company details (Authy) or hope I never lose, replace, or damage my phone (Google Auth). Also, dark theme! Yay!
Great app, works fast and reliably. When will we get the next app update for more icons?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I am currently in the process of moving and finishing my PhD thesis, so I don't have a lot of time at the moment. But I will try to put out a new release soon, there have been a lot of new icons added since the last one...

google_play_reviews.content: the ability to export 2fa secrets makes this app so much useful
It's working fine for other sites for now but it's showing invalid QR code for EA.
Great open source authentication app!
Great authenticstor app. Secure, Open-Source with option to create encryoted and unencrypted backups!
Absolute best authenticator app on playstore. Backup feature is a godsend.
honestly perfect for 2FA due to the ability to backup
App is great. Small size, easy to use, backup functionality. üëçüëçüëç Just one suggestion please add fingerprint unlock.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Fingerprint unlock is already added, you need to switch the "Database encryption" to "Android KeyStore" and then you can use "Device credentials" for authentication, which include fingerprint.
Sadly because of the way fingerprint reading is implemented in Android it is currently not possible to use fingerprint unlocking without the KeyStore.

google_play_reviews.content: Great App, please add function to add own small image not just predefined.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: It's on the TODO list for the rewrite (https://github.com/andOTP/andOTP/wiki/The-Rewrite).

google_play_reviews.content: Best OTP authenticator. Open source and great in functions.

Best OTP out there, allow backup of key and plus app has no internet access at all compare to google/authy. You got to ask yourself, why does Google OTP need internet access? Is definitely not for backup, as it doesn't it support offline backup. Also it would nice to add custom logo/icons.
Doesn't work on the latest update on Android 9. Pixel 3 rom. It just closes when I try to restore. I'll update review if it's something on my end ie authentication settings
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Please open a bug report on Github and include a log. I am running it on an Android 9 ROM right now and everything works fine so I can't really help without a log.

google_play_reviews.content: Phenomenal. Absolutely amazing. I have been first a Google Authenticator user, until the license went proprietary. Then I switched to FreeOTP. After preparing to switch phones, I realized that FreeOTP doesn't backup the entries. I was able to get a backup through adb and decrypt and extract the tokens.xml, to get my secrets. Then I discovered andOTP. I successfully rescanned all my secrets into andOTP.  I LOVE that I can hide entries by default. I LOVE that it supports PIN/Password locking. I LOVE that it has backups, and supports OpenPGP. Everything about this app is amazing.  My only gripe would be the red text on green background, which isn't very visible for red/green color blindness. But that's not worth taking away a star.  Phenomenal app.
Best authenticator app with backup support!

Why is Fingerprint unlock still not implemented? I hate typing the pin each 
time I open the app. Please add Fingerprint unlock feature ASAP. If Authy 
can do it then why can't you?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Fingerprint authentication is already in the app. To use it switch the database encryption to "Android KeyStore" and select "Device credentials" as authentication method. After that you can unlock the app with your fingerprint.
